option.name: originalContent
option.value:
name: CI
on: push: branches: [ master, main ] pull_request: workflow_dispatch:
jobs: test: strategy: matrix: os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest] python-version: ['3.10', '3.11', '3.12', '3.x'] fail-fast: false runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }} steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 with: fetch-depth: 0 # Needed for setuptools-scm - uses: actions/setup-python@v5 with: python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }} - name: Install dependencies env: CFLAGS: "-O3" CXXFLAGS: "-O3" run: | python -m pip install --upgrade pip pip install -e .[test] - name: Run tests run: pytest

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
name: CI
on: push: branches: [ master, main ] pull_request: workflow_dispatch:
jobs: test: strategy: matrix: os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest] python-version: ['3.10', '3.11', '3.12', '3.x'] fail-fast: false runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }} steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 with: fetch-depth: 0 # Needed for setuptools-scm - uses: actions/setup-python@v5 with: python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }} - name: Install dependencies env: CFLAGS: "-O3" CXXFLAGS: "-O3" run: | python -m pip install --upgrade pip pip install -e .[test] - name: Run tests run: pytest

option.name: originalContent
option.value:
name: Build and Publish
on: release: types: [published] workflow_dispatch:
jobs: build-wheels: name: Build wheels on ${{ matrix.os }} runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }} strategy: matrix: os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest] include: - os: ubuntu-latest cflags: "-O3" - os: macos-latest cflags: "-O3" - os: windows-latest cflags: "/O2" steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 with: fetch-depth: 0 # Needed for setuptools-scm to get proper version - uses: actions/setup-python@v5 with: python-version: '3.x' - name: Install cibuildwheel run: | python -m pip install --upgrade pip pip install cibuildwheel - name: Build wheels env: CIBW_SKIP: cp36-* cp37-* cp38-* cp39-* CIBW_ENVIRONMENT: "CFLAGS='${{ matrix.cflags }}' CXXFLAGS='${{ matrix.cflags }}'" run: cibuildwheel --output-dir dist - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4 with: name: wheels-${{ matrix.os }} path: dist/*.whl
build-sdist: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 - uses: actions/setup-python@v5 with: python-version: '3.x' - name: Build sdist run: | python -m pip install --upgrade build python -m build --sdist --outdir dist - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4 with: name: sdist path: dist/*.tar.gz
publish: needs: [build-wheels, build-sdist] runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4 with: pattern: '*' path: dist merge-multiple: true - name: Publish to PyPI uses: pypa/gh-action-pypi-publish@release/v1 with: user: __token__ password: ${{ secrets.PYPI_API_TOKEN }} packages_dir: dist skip_existing: true

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
name: Build and Publish
on: release: types: [published] workflow_dispatch:
jobs: build-wheels: name: Build wheels on ${{ matrix.os }} runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }} strategy: matrix: os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest] include: - os: ubuntu-latest cflags: "-O3" - os: macos-latest cflags: "-O3" - os: windows-latest cflags: "/O2" steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 with: fetch-depth: 0 # Needed for setuptools-scm to get proper version - uses: actions/setup-python@v5 with: python-version: '3.x' - name: Install cibuildwheel run: | python -m pip install --upgrade pip pip install cibuildwheel - name: Build wheels env: CIBW_SKIP: cp36-* cp37-* cp38-* cp39-* CIBW_ENVIRONMENT: "CFLAGS='${{ matrix.cflags }}' CXXFLAGS='${{ matrix.cflags }}'" run: cibuildwheel --output-dir dist - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4 with: name: wheels-${{ matrix.os }} path: dist/*.whl
build-sdist: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 with: fetch-depth: 0 # Needed for setuptools-scm - uses: actions/setup-python@v5 with: python-version: '3.x' - name: Build sdist run: | python -m pip install --upgrade build python -m build --sdist --outdir dist - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4 with: name: sdist path: dist/*.tar.gz
publish: needs: [build-wheels, build-sdist] runs-on: ubuntu-latest environment: name: pypi url: https://pypi.org/p/prefixtrie permissions: id-token: write # For trusted publishing steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4 with: pattern: '*' path: dist merge-multiple: true - name: Publish to PyPI uses: pypa/gh-action-pypi-publish@release/v1 with: packages-dir: dist skip-existing: true

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# Changelog ### Features - Efficient exact and approximate string matching - Configurable maximum substitutions - Optional indel (insertion/deletion) support - Optimized for read-only use cases - Aggressive caching for performance - C++ backend for speed
[Unreleased]: https://github.com/austinv11/PrefixTrie/compare/v0.1.0...HEAD [0.1.0]: https://github.com/austinv11/PrefixTrie/releases/tag/v0.1.0

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
import pyximport pyximport.install() from prefixtrie._impl import cPrefixTrie
# Test the exact flag issue print("=== Testing exact flag behavior ===")
entries = ["hello", "help", "helicopter"] trie = cPrefixTrie(entries, allow_indels=True)
# Test the failing case result, exact = trie.search("helllo", correction_budget=1) print(f"'helllo' -> '{result}', exact={exact} (should be exact=False)")
# Test some other cases for comparison result, exact = trie.search("hello", correction_budget=1) print(f"'hello' -> '{result}', exact={exact} (should be exact=True)")
result, exact = trie.search("hallo", correction_budget=1) print(f"'hallo' -> '{result}', exact={exact} (should be exact=False)")
# Test without budget (should only find exact matches) result, exact = trie.search("helllo", correction_budget=0) print(f"'helllo' (budget=0) -> '{result}', exact={exact} (should be None)")
# Test if it's actually the same string print(f"\nString comparison: 'helllo' == 'hello': {'helllo' == 'hello'}") print(f"Lengths: 'helllo'={len('helllo')}, 'hello'={len('hello')}")

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
import pyximport pyximport.install() from prefixtrie._impl import cPrefixTrie
# Test the specific insertion issue print("=== Testing insertion logic ===")
# Simple case: "hel" should find "help" with 1 insertion trie = cPrefixTrie(["help"], allow_indels=True) result, exact = trie.search("hel", correction_budget=1) print(f"'hel' -> 'help': {result} (should be 'help')")
# Even simpler case: "he" should find "help" with 2 insertions result, exact = trie.search("he", correction_budget=2) print(f"'he' -> 'help': {result} (should be 'help')")
# Test at trie boundary: "h" should find "help" with 3 insertions result, exact = trie.search("h", correction_budget=3) print(f"'h' -> 'help': {result} (should be 'help')")
# Test empty string should find "help" with 4 insertions result, exact = trie.search("", correction_budget=4) print(f"'' -> 'help': {result} (should be 'help')")

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
import pyximport pyximport.install() from prefixtrie._impl import cPrefixTrie
# Debug the failing test case print("=== Debugging insertion/deletion behavior ===")
entries = ["hello", "help", "helicopter"] trie = cPrefixTrie(entries, allow_indels=True)
# Test the failing case query = "helo" result, exact = trie.search(query, correction_budget=1) print(f"Query: '{query}' -> Result: '{result}', Exact: {exact}") print(f"Expected: 'hello' (insertion of 'l')") print(f"Actual result needs: {len(query)} -> {len(result)} chars")
# Let's test what happens with different queries test_cases = [ ("helo", 1), # missing 'l' - should be "hello" ("hel", 1), # missing 'p' - should be "help" ("helllo", 1), # extra 'l' - should be "hello" ("helpx", 1), # extra 'x' - should be "help" ]
print("\n=== Testing various edit scenarios ===") for query, budget in test_cases: result, exact = trie.search(query, correction_budget=budget) print(f"'{query}' (budget={budget}) -> '{result}' (exact={exact})")
# Test with each entry individually to see algorithm preference print("\n=== Testing with individual entries ===") for entry in entries: single_trie = cPrefixTrie([entry], allow_indels=True) result, exact = single_trie.search("helo", correction_budget=1) print(f"Single entry '{entry}': 'helo' -> '{result}' (exact={exact})")
# Test edit distances manually print("\n=== Manual edit distance analysis ===") print("'helo' -> 'hello': 1 insertion (insert 'l' at position 2)") print("'helo' -> 'help': 1 substitution ('o' -> 'p') + 1 deletion (remove 'o')") print("Wait, that's wrong. Let me recalculate:") print("'helo' -> 'help': actually needs 2 edits (substitute 'o'->'p', then what?)") print() print("Let's check character by character:") print("helo -> hello: h=h, e=e, l=l, o->l (substitute), +o (insert) = 2 edits") print("helo -> help: h=h, e=e, l=l, o->p (substitute) = 1 edit") print() print("Actually, I think 'help' IS the correct answer for 'helo' with 1 edit!")
# Debug another failing case print("\n=== Debugging 'hell' case ===") query = "hell" result, exact = trie.search(query, correction_budget=1) print(f"Query: '{query}' -> Result: '{result}', Exact: {exact}")
print("\nEdit distance analysis:") print("'hell' -> 'hello': insert 'o' at end = 1 edit") print("'hell' -> 'help': substitute 'l'->'p' at position 3 = 1 edit") print("Both require exactly 1 edit, so either could be valid!")
# Debug the "hel" case print("\n=== Debugging 'hel' case ===") query = "hel" result, exact = trie.search(query, correction_budget=1) print(f"Query: '{query}' -> Result: '{result}', Exact: {exact}")
print("\nEdit distance analysis:") print("'hel' -> 'hello': insert 'l' at pos 3, insert 'o' at pos 4 = 2 edits") print("'hel' -> 'help': insert 'p' at pos 3 = 1 edit") print("'hel' -> 'helicopter': insert many chars = many edits")
# Test with individual entries print("\n=== Testing 'hel' with individual entries ===") for entry in entries: single_trie = cPrefixTrie([entry], allow_indels=True) result, exact = single_trie.search("hel", correction_budget=1) print(f"Single entry '{entry}': 'hel' -> '{result}' (exact={exact})")
# Test what happens with budget 2 result, exact = trie.search("hel", correction_budget=2) print(f"\nWith budget 2: 'hel' -> '{result}' (exact={exact})")
